content.prompt: What does Jupiter do in the words <u>Es</u> . . . <u>proles</u> (line 1)?

choices.label: He asserts his power over all the gods.
He describes his concern for his Trojan descendants.
He explains to Juno that he cannot alter fate.

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2
